overview: Gary Fish is founder and CEO of FishNet Security, Inc., headquartered in Overland Park, Kansas. Mr. Fish founded FishNet Security in 1996 and, since its inception, has led the organization to be one of the fastest-growing and most-respected information security firms in the United States. In 2005, Mr. Fish positioned FishNet Security to obtain $12 million in private equity investments, helping to perpetuate his vision of continued growth and stability. In 2006, Mr. Fish showed his strengths as both a leader and strategist, by leading the company through the successful acquisition of SiegeWorks LLC and True North Solutions Commercial Operations, officially making FishNet Security the largest private Information Security Solutions Provider in the country. In 2007, with revenues of over $200 million, 26 offices and nearly 300 employees, Mr. Fish led the company to another successful private equity investment of $100 million. In December 2011, FishNet Security acquired Logic Trends, a leading Identity and Access Management company. Mr. Fish has a degree in electronics from DeVry University, served in the Army National Guard and is certified in many areas of technological and business expertise. With more than 20 years of experience in the information technology field, Mr. Fish is regarded as a pioneer in the information security industry. He actively serves on the advisory boards for numerous national and global technology companies. In 1999, Fish was named as one of the Top 25 Executives for the New Millennium in computer-related fields. In 2001, Ernst & Young honored Mr. Fish as the Technology Entrepreneur of the Year for the state of Kansas and Western Missouri. Mr. Fish is a serial entrepreneur, involved in many business endeavors, including a successful information security application development company, Secure Passage. As well as being active in the business community, Mr. Fish leads a strong social responsibility by keeping himself and the organization involved with many charitable and non-profit organizations.
